page.title: 03Southfleet Church
page.content: The Church of St Nicholas,Southfleet was built in the fourteenth century. Some of the stone used in the building came from an earlier Church and from the Roman buildings at Springhead.The south door is made of oak and dates from the fourteenth century.There is a fifteenth century font with interesting carvings on the side.There are five brasses in the church.The unusual thing about them is that 2 of them are of the same lady,Joan Urban. One was made in 1414 when she died and another was made of her and her husband when he died in 1420.There is a Roll of Honour in the church to commemorate the people of Southfleet who gave their lives in the two World Wars.One page is turned over each week and on Remembrance Sunday all the names are read out before the 2 minutes silence.
